head.title: A Split Phone Exchange Is Not a Good Idea

hedline.hl1: A Split Phone Exchange Is Not a Good Idea

abstract.p: Harry K Movchine letter opposes Bell Atlantic's plan to split phone exchanges into two different area codes (S)

block.p: How absurd and how shortsighted can a world-class telephone company become if it allows the splitting of a telephone exchange (528 and 526, for example) into two different area codes (915 and 845)? We in the 528 exchange will have to think whether our neighbors next door or down the block are in Putnam County or in Westchester County. It would be intelligent to make a rule that a telephone exchange cannot be split into two different area codes.
